column4: Is it normal that ubuntu alternate install asks for another cd?
but it does it asks for Ubuntu 7.04 Feisty Fawn_ - Release i386 (20070415)
did you check the MD5 of the downloaded CD?
no, but the cd has checked itself
and found itself to be ok
where exactly does it ask for the other CD?
i suggest you check the MD5, cuz i think its a problem with the CD
it is at 85% of the installation
can I still md5 the cd then?
you have to check the MD5 of the CD iso you downloaded
I can't even change the cd, because it doesn't open the tray :)
thanks I'm going to check it now, and  maybe burn another one.
Cheese, try doubli clicking the file..
you won't believe it, but the CD is fine...
maybe it is the ide connector then...
